FuncDef:
The rip version 2 multicast command sets that RIP-2 packets are sent in multicast mode.
The undo rip version command restores the default RIP version.
By default, the version running on an interface is 1.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that RIP-2 packets are sent in multicast mode.
By default, RIP-2 packets are sent in multicast mode.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The versions of request and response packets vary with the configured RIP version.
If the RIP version is set to RIP-2, a device sends only RIP-2 packets in multicast mode and receives RIP-2 packets that are sent in multicast or broadcast mode.If the RIP version is set to multicast RIP-2, a device sends RIP-2 packets in multicast mode and receives RIP-2 packets that are sent in multicast mode.

Precautions
You can also set a RIP version in a RIP process, but the RIP version that is set on an interface has a higher priority.
